Andy Coravos

I‚Äôm Andy Coravos, a founder, writer, and researcher interested in life sciences, the brain/mind, philosophy, poetry & metaphor, and more.

I co-founded HumanFirst, where I served as CEO for 7 years, unlocking better research for all humans, sooner. We sold the company to ICON (NASDAQ: ICLR) in 2024. After launching the Atlas platform, I am taking a sabbatical.

I like finding things that make life better, and then scaling them so more people have access. Software and science is often the mechanism, but not always.

What‚Äôs getting my attention today

  • Writing and Research üìù I‚Äôll be publishing a few pieces on selling SaaS into pharma and biotechs, public company M&A, investing in TV & Broadway, and more.
  • Tinkering üëæ I‚Äôm a big fan of side quests during sabbatical. Been playing around with LLMs, learning music, and writing comics.
  • Angel investing üí∏ I‚Äôve made 60+ angel investments. Some of my public investments are listed on Crunchbase.
  • M&A advisory üìà I‚Äôve been advising portfolio companies for the past 10 years. After we completed HumanFirst‚Äôs public company transaction, I‚Äôve been helping other founders navigate their M&A processes, focusing on lower to mid-market transactions (sub $250M) that boutique banks can‚Äôt or won‚Äôt do.

About

While on sabbatical, I split my time between Dublin, Ireland and Brooklyn, NY.

For the past 9 years, I‚Äôve served on the Board of Directors of VisionSpring. Every year, we help hundreds of thousands of people get access to quality eye care.

Before HumanFirst, I served as an EIR at the FDA in the Digital Health Unit, and before that, a software engineer at Instacart and Akili Interactive, a leader in digital medicine and developer of the first FDA-cleared video game.

Before transitioning into engineering, I worked at KKR Capstone and McKinsey, where I focused on the healthcare, energy, and financial industries. Duke Grad. Birder. Co-founded CODE@HBS, the computer science and engineering organization at Harvard Business School. I have a not-so-secret obsession with all things Taylor Swift.

Past Orgs and Projects

  • Co-founded and CEO of HumanFirst, which we sold to ICON plc (NASDAQ: ICLR), enabling precision measures in clinical research. Press: WSJ, Forbes, TechCrunch.
  • Founding team at Ummo, a personalized speech coach. Public speaking is hard, Ummo makes it easier. Showcased by the Apple App Store as The Top 3 ‚ÄúApps We Love‚Äù in Spring 2016.
  • Former advisor to the Biohacking Village at DEFCON, and a proud supporter of WeHeartHackers.org, a collaborative movement between the medical device and security researcher communities
  • With a few other entrepreneurs, we launched a side-project called #MovingForward, which highlights VCs committed to diverse, inclusive, and harassment-free workplaces. Press: WIRED, CNN, Recode, Pando, Bloomberg, and Institutional Investor.

Angel Investing Process

  • Step 1: Send me an email; I‚Äôll review a deck, but a product I can play with is even better
  • Step 2: Zoom meeting (30 min or so)
  • Step 3: Asynchronous due diligence, and I‚Äôll let you know within 48 hours üí∏
